results.title: Surf sail
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Cook Strait, which separates the North and South Islands of New Zealand, is one of the most dangerous stretches of water in the world. Three people attempt to cross the Strait, with its unpredictable conditions, tides and currents, on wind surfboards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Surcouf
results.creator_credit: Roy Rowland and Georges de la Giraudiere
results.brief_description:
The first of two films (in our collection) recounting the exploits of famous privateer Robert Surcouf and starring Gerard Barray. On 6 October 1801, in the Sea of Bengal, Surcouf and his crew attack the English vessel ‘Kent’. See also: Le Retour de Surcouf (X000345, 16mm).

Credits: Producer, Georges de la Giraudiere ; director, Roy Rowland ; photography, Juan Gelpi.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Antonella Lualdi, Genevieve Casile, Terrence Morgan.

results.title: Superstar: the life and times of Andy Warhol
results.creator_credit: Chuck Workman, Marilyn Lewis Entertainment and Aries Cinematografica Argentina
results.brief_description: This documentary on Pop artist Andy Warhol, garnered accolades due to its audacious layering of media messages with archival footage from the art scene of the 70s and 80s. Rather than attempting a literal explanation of the enduring appeal of Warhol’s art, and the public’s fascination with the fabulous nobodies who populated his New York studio, the filmmaker presents a meditation on fame and celebrity, exploring the zeitgeist of the times. Features many intriguing archival interviews with Warhol, which exacerbates his image as a vacuous artist, whilst failing to expose the man behind the myth. Also investigates Warhol’s films that confounded cinemagoers of the day. The unpretentiousness of Warhol’s Pennsylvanian family, who are interviewed at length, contrasts with his high-profile celebrity laden life in New York. Interviews with Warhol’s contemporaries (some archival) include Lou Reed, Joan Quinn, Ultra Violet, Viva, Tom Wolfe, Roy Liechtenstein, Henry Geldzahler, Dennis Hopper, Gerard Malanga, Taylor Mead, John Coplans, David Hockney, Allen Ginsberg, Holly Woodlawn, Bobby Short, Shelley Winters, Sylvia Miles, Paul Morrissey, Fran Lebowitz and Sally Kirkland. Features the music of Blondie, Velvet Underground and Kate Bush.

results.title: Superstar
results.creator_credit: Bruce McCulloch, Lorne Michaels, NBC Studios and Superstar Productions USA
results.brief_description: Based on her popular “Saturday night live” character Mary Katherine Gallagher, Molly Shannon stars in this feature length, musical, romantic, film homage. Mary lives with her grandmother and ever since she was a child has dreamed of having a “proper” kiss and believes becoming a superstar will make this possible. It’s a hard task however, as Mary is the brunt of many jokes at school, especially by the bitchiest blonde at Saint Monica’s, Evian (Elaine Hendrix), who is dating Mary’s object of affection, Sky Corrigan (Will Ferrell). Mary has a good pool of resources at her disposal however for transformation, she is the rewind girl at the video store and her parents were professional step-dancing champions. When the school has a talent contest to promote the fight against venereal disease, Mary has the opportunity she has dreamt of by competing for the joy of winning, and the prize of going to Hollywood (to play an extra). This charming film is a fantasy world of boys, dance, kissing, monologues from made for television films, as well as numerous film references. There is a fine supporting cast too in Mary’s special-ed class mates the wire mouthed strongwoman Helen (Emmy Laybourne), silent new boy in town Slater (Harland Williams), and Mary’s grandmother (Glynis Johns).

results.title: Supervise with care: three studies in worker supervision
results.brief_description: Describes three studies in worker supervision: expert workers who become annoyed when a supervisor takes notes of details without explanation; proper distribution of work among seniors and juniors brought about by discussion between supervisors and seniors; in placing junior workers, supervisors should consider their abilities.
